# Rt. 128 Elite: The Go-To Law Firms of Boston
## In our series of White Sandal round-ups, Lake Whillans presents this handy primer on The Go-To Law Firms of Boston.
By [Brian Dalton](https://abovethelaw.com/author/brian-dalton/)  
onSeptember 22, 2016 at 5:01 PMOctober 3, 2016 at 2:18 PM
33
Shares[](http://twitter.com/share?url=http://abovethelaw.com/2016/09/rt-128-elite-the-go-to-law-firms-of-boston/&text=Rt.%20128%20Elite:%20The%20Go-To%20Law%20Firms%20of%20Boston)[](http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=http://abovethelaw.com/2016/09/rt-128-elite-the-go-to-law-firms-of-boston/&display=popup&ref=plugin&src=share_button)[](http://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=http://abovethelaw.com/2016/09/rt-128-elite-the-go-to-law-firms-of-boston/)[](javascript:void("#ea-share-count-email"))

(Photo of Boston by Robbie Shade)

Earlier this year, a leader in the field of litigation finance, our friends at Lake Whillans, provided a look at the [“White Sandal” firms of Silicon Valley](https://abovethelaw.com/2016/05/the-white-sandal-elite-the-go-to-law-firms-of-silicon-valley/) — an indisputable tech hub where all manner of innovation is thriving. [Lake Whillans](http://www.lakewhillans.com) supports innovative entrepreneurs and businesses across the country, including those in other vital epicenters of tech innovation. Over the coming months, we will explore the legal markets in these hubs, each unique in its own right.

Today, we look to Boston, which is home to a flurry of startup activity, fueled by a robust level of venture capital funding and a high concentration of sheer talent, exemplified by world-class universities, notably Harvard and MIT.

Of course, the Boston legal market — like that of [Silicon Valley](http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/litigation-finance-leader-lake-whillans-expands-opening-palo-alto-office-300230623.html) — extends well beyond the cadre of long-established Biglaw titans (e.g., WilmerHale, Ropes & Gray) to include a complex ecosystem of specialist boutiques and smaller firms with deep local roots and thriving practices in areas ranging from estate planning to restructuring to white collar defense. And in these hotbed cities of tech and startup activity, there’s also plenty of cutting-edge patent, IPO, and M&A work.

In our series of White Sandal round-ups, Lake Whillans presents this handy primer on The Go-To Law Firms of Boston. These firms not only can handle every transactional need, but they do anything from taxes to setting up HR review processes. Engaging these firms can help the tech startups, unicorns, and venture capitalists of the new economy avoid or contain problems down the road. Should legal issues arise, Lake Whillans can step in and help resolve them.

##1. Best Firm for One-Horned Horsey Creatures: [Choate Hall & Stewart LLP](https://www.choate.com/)


When it comes to finding investors for your latest pipe dream, there’s no one better to have in your corner than the folks at Choate. Headquartered and firmly rooted in Boston since 1899, the firm is consistently ranked among the best shops in the country for venture capital and private equity. With an emphasis on emerging companies, this transaction powerhouse has assisted clients in all sectors with more than $20 billion in public company security offerings since 2000 alone. When you’re ready to turn that crazy idea into a reality, these are the folks you want to call.

##2. Best Firm for Patenting Your Algorithm or Application: [Fish & Richardson](http://www.fr.com)


Founded in Boston in 1878, Fish & Richardson has risen to global prominence as one of the world’s premier intellectual property firms. For more than a century, the firm has been universally recognized as a patent law powerhouse. Assisting clients in every sector, from nanotechnology to alternative fuels to healthcare, the firm’s attorneys are dedicated to protecting innovation in all its forms. Not only can they help you apply for your patent, they have the litigation chops to protect your patent rights from infringers. This is unquestionably your go-to firm for all things patent-related.

##3. Best Firm for Trademarking the Logo You Think Is So Cool: [Sunstein Kann Murphy & Timbers LLP](http://sunsteinlaw.com/)


This boutique IP firm provides a depth of trademark law expertise that belies the practice’s small size. Dedicated to trademark protection worldwide, the firm’s attorneys are adept at procuring and enforcing trademarks in every corner of the globe. With a roster of clients spanning every industry — from pharmaceuticals to the arts — this is the firm you need when your trademark rights are on the line. Beyond securing trademark rights, they have a proven track record of enforcing and defending those rights in tribunals and courts around the world.

##4. Best Firm for Suing the Bigger Company That Stole Your Intellectual Property: [Goodwin Procter LLP](http://www.goodwinlaw.com/)


Native to Beantown, Goodwin has spent the past century making a name for itself in all aspects of business law and litigation. Of particular note, the firm’s commitment to innovation has earned it wide renown as a leader in IP litigation, and the firm’s attorneys have rightly received accolades as one of the top IP practices in the country. With a dedication to serving Boston’s growing technology sector, they are prepared to handle all facets of trademark and patent litigation. If your intellectual property rights are in jeopardy, these are the folks you want to call.

##5. Best Firm for When You Actually Find Yourself in a Courtroom: [WilmerHale](https://www.wilmerhale.com/)


With a team of nearly 500 litigators across the globe, WilmerHale has firmly cemented a spot among the elite litigation firms in the country. The Boston team is certainly no exception to the firm’s dispute-resolution greatness. Having made a name for itself in securities and white-collar work, Wilmer’s attorneys have more recently come to be known as the go-to people for intellectual property litigation. You will find the firm’s name on the dockets of many of the world’s biggest cases, spanning nearly every industry. Well versed in all aspects of litigation, there is one thing you can be sure of: These lawyers are not afraid of the courtroom.

##6. Best Firm for Keeping That Glass Ceiling Off: [Seyfarth Shaw LLP](http://www.seyfarth.com/)


A recognized leader in the field, this firm was one of the first to specialize in labor and employment law. Launched in 1999, the firm’s Boston office has carried on the practice of being innovators in this area of the law. The firm’s attorneys offer expertise in a range of employment matters, with an exclusive team devoted to pay-equity issues. With the fight for equal pay taking center stage in recent months, no company can afford to fall short or risk running afoul of the law when it comes to employee compensation. Seyfarth’s lawyers will not only help you avoid the risk of litigation, they’ll help you adopt practices that will allow you to maintain a competitive advantage.

##7. Best Firm for Helping You Get Office Space: [Hinckley Allen](http://www.hinckleyallen.com/)


Home to one of the Northeast’s largest real estate practices, Hinckley Allen is renowned for being one of the country’s top real estate law firms. Representing parties on all sides of transactions — from developers to tenants — this firm has cornered the market. No matter how small or complex your transaction may be, the firm’s lawyers have a proven track record of getting the job done right, on time and within budget. Whether you’re looking for a simple office lease or want to undertake a massive commercial redevelopment, these lawyers will deliver the personal service you need.

##8. Best Firm to Keep You Out Of Prison: [J. W. Carney, Jr. & Associates](http://www.carneydefense.com/)


From F. Lee Bailey to Alan Dershowitz, Boston has given us some of our country’s most famous criminal attorneys. With the members of O.J.’s dream team no longer practicing, the biggest player in the Boston criminal defense game these days is none other than J.W. Carney, Jr. Carney cemented his status as one of the legends of the criminal defense world with his defense of some of Boston’s most notorious figures, including mobster “Whitey” Bulger, accused terrorist Tarek Mehanna, and Planned Parenthood shooter John C. Salvi. On regular days, his practice routinely represents everyday criminals in all stages of the criminal justice process. If you’re facing heat from the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, Carney is the guy you want to call.

##9. Best Firm to Win the Trial Over Your Intellectual Property: [Wolf, Greenfield & Sacks, P.C.](http://www.wolfgreenfield.com/)


Founded in Prohibition-era Boston, this firm has risen to prominence as one of the premier intellectual property shops in the Northeast. The firm has played a seminal role in some of the country’s most historically important IP cases, and it has secured the largest jury verdict for trade secret infringement in Massachusetts history. Among the firm’s impressive roster of clients are Fortune 500 companies, cutting-edge startups and Nobel prize winners. No matter your IP issue, the lawyers at Wolf Greenfield have the technical know-how to handle it. When it comes to protecting your innovations, this firm will give you the advantage you need in the courtroom.

##10. Best Firm for When You Need Estate Planning After Your IPO: [Nutter McClennen & Fish LLP](http://www.nutter.com/)


For more than a century, the attorneys at Nutter have been providing unrivaled estate planning advice to high-net-worth individuals. Their services aren’t limited to just traditional legal advice; this firm does it all in the estate planning arena, often serving as fiduciaries, trustees and even guardians. With a focus on long-term planning and big-picture solutions, no aspect of your personal finances will be ignored. It’s easy to get caught up in the excitement of your company taking off. With these lawyers on your side, you’ll have peace of mind knowing your personal and family interests are covered as you focus on growing your business.

##11. Best Firm to Advise Minority Shareholders: [Rudolph Friedmann LLP](http://www.rflawyers.com/)


Rivaling the big firms in business law acumen, this small group of lawyers is your one-stop shop for all your corporate needs. With an entire practice devoted to shareholder and stockholder disputes, the firm has extensive experience advising both majority and minority stockholders about their rights. They’ve seen all the tricks that majority owners use to freeze out minority shareholders, and they’re prepared to defeat them. The firm’s attorneys will fight vigorously to protect your interests while trying to avoid a costly court battle. When the chips are down, though, the firm has the chops to fight for your rights via litigation or alternative-dispute resolution.

##12. Best Firm to Independently Advise the Board of Directors: [Duane Morris LLP](http://www.duanemorris.com/)


This multi-faceted firm has long been advising New England companies in all aspects of business law. With a heavy emphasis on corporate responsibility, the firm’s lawyers offer vast experience in establishing corporate compliance programs and advising on questions of corporate governance. Whether you have questions on reporting obligations or concerns about corporate accountability, this is the firm you want on your side. If you’re staring down criminal liability or regulatory sanctions, Duane Morris is your go-to firm for assessing your situation and mitigating the fallout.

##13. Best Firm to Help You Make Sure You Have Capital to Keep the Lights On Until Daybreak: [Gunderson Dettmer](http://www.gunder.com/)


Touting itself as the leading firm for entrepreneurs, emerging growth companies and venture capitalists, Gunderson sets itself apart from the field of all-purpose firms by focusing solely on the global venture capital and emerging technology marketplace. Their expertise is representing high-growth companies from all industries in all stages of development. Frequently praised for being the most active fund formation and transaction firm in the country, these are the people you want to talk to when you’re worried about having enough capital to keep your emerging company up and running.

##14. Best Firm for Incorporating Your Two-Person Company Because Somebody Told You There Were Tax Benefits: [UpCounsel](https://www.upcounsel.com)


Offering an alternative to the traditional law firm model, UpCounsel has found success in marketing its services to companies without in-house counsel and providing access to legal services at prices small businesses can afford. The company recruits talent from top law firms and companies, and it allows clients to tap into that talent on a project-by-project basis. With attorneys vetted by specialty, you can choose the lawyer you want for exactly what you need done. With the money you save on legal services, you can grow your company into the empire you’ve always dreamed of.

##15. Best Firm for Planning (or Avoiding) the Re-Startup: [Foley Hoag LLP](http://www.foleyhoag.com/)


Boston roots don’t get much deeper than Foley Hoag’s. Among an impressive offering of business law services, the firm boasts a strong bankruptcy and creditor-rights practice that will help you get back on your feet when times get tough. The firm’s lawyers have vast experience with federal and state bankruptcy proceedings and a proven track record of guiding clients through the Chapter 11 process. They know the ins and outs of distressed business scenarios, so if your business is struggling, this is the firm you need to get you through it.

##16. Best Firm to Keep You Out of E-Discovery Hell: [Mintz Levin](https://www.mintz.com/)


Technology has forever changed the landscape of litigation. E-discovery has taken center stage, leading to increased focus on records management — and big headaches for many a corporate legal department. There’s no question that E-discovery is an all-consuming task, and the lawyers with Mintz, Levin, Cohn, Ferris, Glovsky and Popeo, P.C. are pros at tackling the job. With vast experience implementing e-discovery and document retention plans for clients ranging from startups to Fortune 500 companies, this firm adeptly navigates the complicated E-discovery waters by implementing plans that work for your specific business. The firm’s lawyers will help manage your records on the front end so you can avoid a nightmare scenario when litigation comes around.

##17. Best Firm for When You Are Ready to Get into the Asian Market:[ Ropes & Gray LLP](https://www.ropesgray.com/)


Founded 150 years ago, this venerable Boston institution has expanded far beyond its Boston roots to become a major player in the Asian markets. With offices in Hong Kong, Tokyo, Seoul, and Shanghai, the firm’s Asia Pacific practice group has intimate knowledge of Asia’s dynamic markets and a reach that far surpasses its presence on the ground. Representing everyone from investment banks to top tech innovators, the firm’s attorneys have a proven track record of assisting some of the world’s largest corporations with every aspect of business law, including M&A transactions, fund formation, capital markets issues and global IP litigation. Their market knowledge makes them the go-to firm for anyone in Boston hoping to become a player in the Asian arena.

##18. Best Firm for Designing Your Employee Stock-Option Plan: [Dechert LLP](https://www.dechert.com/)


Since 1987, Dechert’s Boston office has been advising clients on a range of corporate and financial matters. With a specific emphasis on benefit plans and executive compensation, the firm’s lawyers have vast experience designing retirement compensation plans that comply with all the relevant and confusing laws. From tax issues to golden parachutes, no aspect of employee benefits is too complicated for these corporate gurus to handle. For sound advice on stock options, this is your firm.

##19. Best Firm for Lobbying Congress in Your Favor: [Considine & Furey, LLP](http://www.considinefurey.com/)


If you’re in Boston and looking for a firm that knows its way around Capitol Hill, look no further than Considine & Furey. With a full roster of registered lobbyists and a large portion of the firm’s resources devoted to government relations, the firm is unrivaled in the city when it comes to lobbying for issues that matter most to your business. From automotive companies to emerging biotech firms, the firm’s attorneys are committed to obtaining the best possible results for their clients. When your livelihood relies on seeing results in Washington, this is the firm you call.

##20. Best Jack-of-All-Trades Firm for High-Growth Companies: [Skadden](https://www.skadden.com/)


The name Skadden has long been synonymous with greatness, and there’s no doubt this powerhouse firm can handle any legal question that’s thrown its way. Offering nearly every legal specialty imaginable, the firm continues to rise above the rest in the field of M&A. With a client roster that reads like a who’s who of the world’s Fortune 500 companies, the firm’s lawyers in 22 offices around the globe can take your business wherever it wants to go. Venture capitalists, emerging growth companies and entrepreneurs universally recognize this firm as the go-to shop for the most complex issues faced by high-growth companies in today’s market.

                                                                                                                                         

This column is by Lake Whillans Litigation Finance. To learn more about us, and litigation finance generally, visit us at our website at[ lakewhillans.com](http://bit.ly/1HjGYMY), [Twitter](http://bit.ly/1LjYX8D) or [LinkedIn.](http://bit.ly/1KB4UXG)

# Another Elite Firm Matches New Special Bonus Scale
## We're bringing the whole gang into this special bonus job.
By [Joe Patrice](https://abovethelaw.com/author/joe-patrice/)  
onMarch 25, 2021 at 11:48 AMMarch 26, 2021 at 6:44 AM
1
Shares[](https://twitter.com/share?url=https://abovethelaw.com/2021/03/debevoise-spring-bonuses/&text=Another%20Elite%20Firm%20Matches%20New%20Special%20Bonus%20Scale)[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://abovethelaw.com/2021/03/debevoise-spring-bonuses/&display=popup&ref=plugin&src=share_button)[](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https://abovethelaw.com/2021/03/debevoise-spring-bonuses/)[](javascript:void("#ea-share-count-email"))
Bonus season in Biglaw is a lot like a heist movie. One character gets a crazy idea. But, for whatever reason, it doesn’t quite work out for them. They’re just not ready to tackle this alone. Enter the older and wiser character who explains that this is going to have to be a much bigger job. Then the next act involves the newly appointed leader going around and visiting the old crew to bring them back for one last score. After initial pushback, accompanied by saying something like, “I’m getting too old for this,” one by one the crew responds, “[You son of a bitch, I’m in!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kkZpgEhxAYo)”

[Willkie Farr took the first shot](https://abovethelaw.com/2021/03/willkie-spring-bonuses-2021/) with a $7,500-$40,000 special bonus. [Davis Polk came in and raised the stakes](https://abovethelaw.com/2021/03/davis-polk-spring-special-bonus-2021/) to $12,000-$64,000 spread over two payout dates. And since then it’s been a non-stop parade of top firms declaring, in deeds if not words, “You son of a bitch, I’m in.”

Just last night we got [Cleary](https://abovethelaw.com/2021/03/cleary-spring-bonus/) and [Paul Weiss](https://abovethelaw.com/2021/03/paul-weiss-special-bonus-2021)… so obviously Debevoise wasn’t far behind with another Wednesday evening announcement. But with a twist!

[  ](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
[Sponsored](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
### [ Legal AI: 3 Steps Law Firms Should Take Now ](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
If 2023 introduced legal professionals to generative AI, then 2024 will be when law firms start adapting to utilize it. Things are moving fast, so…
From [LexisNexis](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)  


Yes, Debevoise is joining [Skadden](https://abovethelaw.com/2021/03/skadden-spring-bonuses/) in offering equal distributions instead of weighting the bonus toward the latter date. Though unlike Skadden, who paid out the back end in December, Debevoise is pushing that latter payout date up to September.

Congratulations everyone. Can’t wait for the annual bonus sequel… maybe some time around Thanksgiving?

Full memo on the next page.

As soon as your firm’s bonus memo comes out, please [email it to us](mailto:tips@abovethelaw.com?subject=%5BFirm%20Name%5D%20Bonus) (subject line: “[Firm Name] Bonus”) or text us (646-820-8477). Please include the memo if available. You can take a photo of the memo and send it via text or email if you don’t want to forward the original PDF or Word file.

And if you’d like to sign up for ATL’s Bonus Alerts, please scroll down and enter your email address in the box below this post. If you previously signed up for the bonus alerts, you don’t need to do anything. You’ll receive an email notification within minutes of each bonus announcement that we publish.

# The Client Service A-Team: Ranking The Biglaw Superheroes Of Client Service (2023)
## Which firms are among the best of the best?
By [Staci Zaretsky](https://abovethelaw.com/author/staci-zaretsky/)  
onApril 6, 2023 at 10:42 AMApril 6, 2023 at 10:06 AM
7
Shares[](https://twitter.com/share?url=https://abovethelaw.com/2023/04/the-client-service-a-team-ranking-the-biglaw-superheroes-of-client-service-2023/&text=The%20Client%20Service%20A-Team:%20Ranking%20The%20Biglaw%20Superheroes%20Of%20Client%20Service%20(2023))[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://abovethelaw.com/2023/04/the-client-service-a-team-ranking-the-biglaw-superheroes-of-client-service-2023/&display=popup&ref=plugin&src=share_button)[](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https://abovethelaw.com/2023/04/the-client-service-a-team-ranking-the-biglaw-superheroes-of-client-service-2023/)[](javascript:void("#ea-share-count-email"))
Which Biglaw firms are most beloved by general counsel for their superior client service? If that seems like it was a steep hill to climb during the roller coaster of a year that was 2022, that’s because it was. The BTI Consulting Group set to find out which firms handled the task with ease with its latest ranking, the Client Service A-Team. In case you’re unfamiliar with this ranking, it measures the top 30 law firms corporate counsel identify as delivering the very best in terms of client service. (This year, because midsize firms really excelled while under fire, the ranking that now covers the Client Service 30, the Client Service 100, and the Client Service 200.)

To compile the ranking, BTI Consulting spoke with more than 350 in-house decision-makers who were asked to name firms that excelled in 17 different client-service-related activities, seven of which reigned supreme above all overs, including: mobilizing resources quickly, fielding the absolute best team, quickly assessing the situation, a commitment to help, delivering value for the dollar, client focus, and understanding the client’s business.

So, which firms are considered the best of the best when it comes to client service? Per BTI Consulting, the firms that made the latest top 30 ranking performed 70% better than the typical firm in terms of client service. As the ranking notes, “client service stalwarts continue to invest relentlessly [in client service] — no matter how well they do. They are convinced they can do better.”

Here are the top 10 firms that made the [Client Service A-Team](https://bticonsulting.com/themadclientist/clients-single-out-law-firms-delivering-the-best-client-service-by-name), whose names were mentioned most often across all categories:

1. Kirkland & Ellis
2. Ogletree
3. Jones Day
4. McGuireWoods
5. Gibson Dunn
6. DLA Piper
7. Littler
8. Ropes & Gray
9. Mintz
10. King & Spalding

Kirkland & Ellis is the new leader of the pack, kicking Jones Day out of the top spot after a six-year stint there. [Law360](https://www.law360.com/corporate/articles/1593697?) (sub. req.) has additional details:

According to Michael Rynowecer, president of BTI Consulting, Kirkland secured the No. 1 spot due to its hard work and commitment to delivering the best client service and experience.

“They’re one of the firms that really brings not just legal skills, but their clients say they bring business understanding and business savvy and business intelligence and new approaches,” Rynowecer said.

If attorneys at your firm make more of an effort to better understand your clients’ businesses, then you may find your place of work on this list next time around. Congratulations to all 30 firms that made it to the highest ranks of the Client Service A-List. You’ve proven yourselves to be outstanding when it comes to making corporate clients happy, and that’s worth celebrating.

[Clients Single Out Law Firms Delivering the Best Client Service — By Name](https://bticonsulting.com/themadclientist/clients-single-out-law-firms-delivering-the-best-client-service-by-name) [Mad Clientist / BTI Consulting]
[Kirkland & Ellis Ranks As Top Client Service Firm](https://www.law360.com/corporate/articles/1593697?) [Law360 (sub. req.)]

# Trump Predicts Justices Ginsburg And Sotomayor Will Die During His Presidency
## Trump would just love it if a pair of powerful, outspoken women got out of his way.
By [Kathryn Rubino](https://abovethelaw.com/author/krubino/)  
onOctober 16, 2017 at 11:35 AMOctober 16, 2017 at 1:31 PM
0
Shares[](https://twitter.com/share?url=https://abovethelaw.com/2017/10/trump-predicts-justices-ginsburg-and-sotomayor-will-die-during-his-presidency/&text=Trump%20Predicts%20Justices%20Ginsburg%20And%20Sotomayor%20Will%20Die%20During%20His%20Presidency)[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://abovethelaw.com/2017/10/trump-predicts-justices-ginsburg-and-sotomayor-will-die-during-his-presidency/&display=popup&ref=plugin&src=share_button)[](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https://abovethelaw.com/2017/10/trump-predicts-justices-ginsburg-and-sotomayor-will-die-during-his-presidency/)[](javascript:void("#ea-share-count-email"))

(photo by Drew Angerer/Getty Images)

Do you need your rage-o-meter to get revved up this morning? Maybe a weekend of social media posts from the women in your life explaining how they have been subjected to sexual harassment or sexual assault wasn’t enough. Well, now Donald Trump is predicting he’ll appoint four Supreme Court justices before his time in office is up.

According to a [report from Axios](https://www.axios.com/trumps-four-justices-2497007846.html), Trump does some nifty math to get to that number. He’s, of course, counting the appointment of Neil Gorsuch. Then he’s counting on Anthony Kennedy to live up to[ the rumors](https://abovethelaw.com/2017/06/no-justice-anthony-m-kennedy-is-not-retiring-tomorrow/) and retire (if Justice Kennedy cares about his legacy on gay rights, he better stay right where President Reagan put him). But to get to the last two appointments he wants, he has to kill off some female jurists:

[  ](https://abovethelaw.com/2024/04/the-business-case-for-ai-at-your-law-firm/)
[Sponsored](https://abovethelaw.com/2024/04/the-business-case-for-ai-at-your-law-firm/)
### [ The Business Case For AI At Your Law Firm ](https://abovethelaw.com/2024/04/the-business-case-for-ai-at-your-law-firm/) 
ChatGPT ushers in the age of generative AI – even for law firms.
From [THOMSON REUTERS](https://abovethelaw.com/2024/04/the-business-case-for-ai-at-your-law-firm/)  
“Ok,” one source told Trump, “so that’s two. Who are the others?”

“Ginsburg,” Trump replied. “What does she weigh? 60 pounds?”

“Who’s the fourth?” the source asked.

“Sotomayor,” Trump said, referring to the relatively recently-appointed Obama justice, whose name is rarely, if ever, mentioned in speculation about the next justice to be replaced. “Her health,” Trump explained. “No good. Diabetes.”

Of course Trump would just love it if a pair of powerful, outspoken women got out of his way.

Listen, prognosticating on the health of Justice Ginsburg is practically a cottage industry. She’s an elderly woman whose age is clearly wearing on her. But, her workout regimen is [no joke](https://abovethelaw.com/2017/02/ruth-bader-ginsburg-is-fit-as-hell/), so that — plus a lot of prayers and well wishes from liberals — will hopefully be enough to get her to survive this administration. But Justice Sotomayor’s [Type-1 diabetes](https://abovethelaw.com/2010/01/scotus-justice-sonia-sotomayor-has-star-power/) shows no signs of slowing her down. If you can’t grab ’em by the pussy, you might as well imagine them dead.

Frankly, this reads more like the president’s wish list of things he wants to happen. Fortunately, unlike healthcare, he can’t really sign an executive order to force anyone’s hand.

# Neal Katyal Dishes On Mark Meadow's Legal 'Total Body Slam'
## It doesn't look good for Mark Meadows.
By [Kathryn Rubino](https://abovethelaw.com/author/krubino/)  
onDecember 19, 2023 at 2:14 PMDecember 19, 2023 at 12:42 PM
13
Shares[](https://twitter.com/share?url=https://abovethelaw.com/2023/12/neal-katyal-dishes-on-mark-meadows-legal-total-body-slam/&text=Neal%20Katyal%20Dishes%20On%20Mark%20Meadow’s%20Legal%20‘Total%20Body%20Slam’)[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://abovethelaw.com/2023/12/neal-katyal-dishes-on-mark-meadows-legal-total-body-slam/&display=popup&ref=plugin&src=share_button)[](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https://abovethelaw.com/2023/12/neal-katyal-dishes-on-mark-meadows-legal-total-body-slam/)[](javascript:void("#ea-share-count-email"))

(Photo by Alex Wong/Getty Images)

When a Republican can’t get the Eleventh Circuit’s William Pryor — [this Judge Pryor](https://abovethelaw.com/2022/11/federal-judge-weeps-for-poor-defenseless-federalist-society-ruthlessly-bullied-by-legal-bloggers/) — to take their side, you know they’re in trouble. When Judge Pryor issues “to put it mildly, a total body slam,” against your argument, well, you’re in for a bad time.

Former White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows wanted the Georgia RICO charges against him stemming from his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 election removed to federal court, claiming the charges were related to his work as a federal official. The Eleventh Circuit affirmed the district court ruling, with the aforementioned Judge Pryor basically saying, LOL, no.

[  ](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
[Sponsored](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
### [ Legal AI: 3 Steps Law Firms Should Take Now ](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)
If 2023 introduced legal professionals to generative AI, then 2024 will be when law firms start adapting to utilize it. Things are moving fast, so…
From [LexisNexis](https://bit.ly/3x7bHOy)  
Hogan Lovells partner Neal Katyal appeared on MSNBC’s The Beat last night to chat about the Eleventh Circuit’s “total body slam.”

“And to basically summarize what this long opinion says, Chief Justice Pryor just basically said, look, if you’re the White House chief of staff, launching a coup is not in your job description. That’s the opinion, plain and simple.”

And Katyal doesn’t think Meadows should be optimistic that the Supreme Court will save him on this one, saying, “I don’t think there’s any chance that this case is going to be something that the Supreme Court is going to grant and rule for Mark Meadows on. This is going nowhere fast.”

You can watch the full clip below.

# Biglaw Salary Hike Extends To One Of The Largest Firms In The World
## Biglaw's follow the leader game finds its 'Piper.'
By [Joe Patrice](https://abovethelaw.com/author/joe-patrice/)  
onJanuary 25, 2022 at 5:31 PM
15
Shares[](https://twitter.com/share?url=https://abovethelaw.com/2022/01/biglaw-salary-hike-extends-to-one-of-the-largest-firms-in-the-world/&text=Biglaw%20Salary%20Hike%20Extends%20To%20One%20Of%20The%20Largest%20Firms%20In%20The%20World)[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://abovethelaw.com/2022/01/biglaw-salary-hike-extends-to-one-of-the-largest-firms-in-the-world/&display=popup&ref=plugin&src=share_button)[](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https://abovethelaw.com/2022/01/biglaw-salary-hike-extends-to-one-of-the-largest-firms-in-the-world/)[](javascript:void("#ea-share-count-email"))
The march of Biglaw salary matches continues. Following Milbank’s decision to up associate base salaries, firms have started to join the party with raises here and there.

Moments ago, one of the largest firms in the world opted to join the prevailing scale. And with over 4,000 attorneys at this point and around $3.1B in revenue, DLA Piper is a behemoth by any measure.

DLA’s associates received some “verein good news” — Swiss business organization puns are too rare to pass up — today when the firm adopted the new scale. The firm employs a joint “Level/Year” compensation system, but the new scale boils down to this:

Class	New Salary
Class of 2021 (Level 1)	$215K
Class of 2020 (Level 1)	$225K
Class of 2019 (Level 1)	$250K
Class of 2018 (Level 2)	$285K
Class of 2017 (Level 2)	$325K
Class of 2016 (Level 2)	$350K
Class of 2015 (Level 2)	$370K
Class of 2014+ (Level 3)	$385K
Associates will see these amounts retroactively applied in their January 28th payout.

Congratulations to all.

Remember everyone, we depend on your tips to stay on top of this stuff. So when your firm matches, please text us (646-820-8477) or [email us](mailto:tips@abovethelaw.com?subject=%5BFirm%20Name%5D%20Matches%20Milbank) (subject line: “[Firm Name] Matches Milbank”). Please include the memo if available. You can take a photo of the memo and send it via text or email if you don’t want to forward the original PDF or Word file.

And if you’d like to sign up for ATL’s Bonus Alerts (which is the alert list we’ll also use for salary announcements), please scroll down and enter your email address in the box below this post. If you previously signed up for the bonus alerts, you don’t need to do anything. You’ll receive an email notification within minutes of each bonus announcement that we publish.

[Joe Patrice](http://abovethelaw.com/author/joe-patrice/) is a senior editor at Above the Law and co-host of [Thinking Like A Lawyer](http://legaltalknetwork.com/podcasts/thinking-like-a-lawyer/). Feel free to [email](mailto:joepatrice@abovethelaw.com) any tips, questions, or comments. Follow him on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/josephpatrice) if you’re interested in law, politics, and a healthy dose of college sports news. Joe also serves as a [Managing Director at RPN Executive Search](https://www.rpnexecsearch.com/josephpatrice).


##Enter your email address to sign up for ATL's Bonus & Salary Increase Alerts.
